parameters.definition: Number of machines capable of making the spare parts
Time taken to make spare part k on machine s
Profit obtained from making spare part k
Capacity of machine s for the spare parts

description: Formulate the problem of determining the quantities of each spare part to be made during the month so as to maximize profit. The number of different spare parts is \param{K}. The number of machines capable of making the spare parts is \param{S}. The time taken to make spare part \param{k} on machine \param{s} is given by \param{Time}. The profit obtained from making spare part \param{k} is \param{Profit}. Each machine \param{s} has a capacity of \param{Capacity} for the spare parts.
